Package lab2

Class Fraction

java.lang.Object
lab2.Fraction
public class Fraction
extends java.lang.Object
This class represent fraction of two integer values A fraction consists of two integers, one for numerator and one for denominator. An example fraction is 1/5. Note: A valid fraction must not have zero in the denominator. No need to simplify or reduce the fraction value *

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private int denominator  
    private int numerator
    The fraction object store two value numerator and denominator as int data type.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Fraction()
    no-arh constructor that constructs fraction object by setting denominator value to 1 and numerator value to zero
    Fraction​(int numerator, int denominator)
    Provide the numerator and denominator value to construct a fraction object.

  • Constructor Details

    • Fraction

      public Fraction()
      no-arh constructor that constructs fraction object by setting denominator value to 1 and numerator value to zero

    • Fraction

      public Fraction​(int numerator, int denominator)
      Provide the numerator and denominator value to construct a fraction object.
      Parameters:
      numerator - the numerator
      denominator - the denominator
      Precondition:

      Precondition

      The input denominator value should be positive denominator>0

    • setFraction

      public void setFraction​(int numerator, int denominator)
      Set the new fraction value for both numerator and denominator.
      Parameters:
      numerator - the new numerator value.
      denominator - the new denominator value.
      Precondition:

      Precondition

    • getAbsValue

      public double getAbsValue()
      Compute the absolute value of the fraction. the returned value should be rounded to seven decimal points.
      Returns:
      the absolute value of the fraction as a double.

    • addFraction

      public void addFraction​(Fraction f)
      Add a fraction (f) to the current fraction. No need to simplify or reduce the fraction value
      Parameters:
      f - the fraction to be added.

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Create a string literal for the fraction. if fraction object created as Fraction f = new Fraction(5,7); then f.toString() returns the string

      "Fraction (5 / 7)".

      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
      Returns:
      the fraction expressed as a String.
